intro: Eremospatha macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited rock fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its woody structure and thick, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by large, edible fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The fruit is an important food source for various wildlife species in its native habitat.
